Package core

Class Connect4

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Connect4
  • public class Connect4
extends java.lang.Object
    connect4Core is the core of a Java connect4 game, which hold all the methods which the UI will use to simulate the game
    Version:
    4.0 April 18th, 2019
    Author:
    Chris Trefts

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String[][] board
      board is a 2dArray which will hold our values and will be the "board", which can be played on
      static java.util.Scanner scan  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Connect4()
      connect4Core constructs a 2d array, which will be used to simulate a game board using java

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkForLimit​(int num)
      checkForLimit is a method just looks at a single in the top row of the board, and is utilized in order to detect a full column and to have the user pick a different spot to play in if true
      boolean checkForSpace()
      checkForSpace is a method which checks every position on the board, and if it cannot find an a single empty space, it will return true and tell the UI to end and inform the players of a tie game
      int checkInt()
      checkInt makes sure the user input is an int and does not break the program
      java.lang.String displayBoard()
      display board is a method (essentially our toString), which display the board to the players and will also update as pieces are played onto the board
      int getCoordinates​(int column)
      getCoordinates return the exact position of the last piece played and is a helper method for Connect4Cleint
      boolean piecePlay​(int column, java.lang.String player)
      piecePlay is used to place the piece in the specific spot the user wants, it first uses the method checkForSpace, so the piecePlay dosen't work if the board it full, and after that the method looks a the specified column looking for an empty space starting from the bottom of the board
      boolean winCheck()
      winCheck is a method which checks to see a player has connected 4, accounting for both diagonals, vertical, and horizontal victories.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • board

        public static java.lang.String[][] board
        board is a 2dArray which will hold our values and will be the "board", which can be played on

      • scan

        public static java.util.Scanner scan

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4

        public Connect4()
        connect4Core constructs a 2d array, which will be used to simulate a game board using java

    • Method Detail

      • displayBoard

        public java.lang.String displayBoard()
        display board is a method (essentially our toString), which display the board to the players and will also update as pieces are played onto the board
        Returns:
        displayBoard displays the board and return the board as a string in a readable fashion

      • checkForSpace

        public boolean checkForSpace()
        checkForSpace is a method which checks every position on the board, and if it cannot find an a single empty space, it will return true and tell the UI to end and inform the players of a tie game
        Returns:
        false if checkForSpace finds a blank spot on the board, and true if it finds no blank spots on the board

      • checkForLimit

        public boolean checkForLimit​(int num)
        checkForLimit is a method just looks at a single in the top row of the board, and is utilized in order to detect a full column and to have the user pick a different spot to play in if true
        Parameters:
        num - is going to be the users input - 1 (in order to account for index and realistic number differences), and is use to look at the top of the column which the play selected, if it checks if there is a symbol at the top of the column seeing if the selected column is full or not
        Returns:
        false if checkForLimit finds no symbol at the top of the selected column and true if it does

      • piecePlay

        public boolean piecePlay​(int column,
                         java.lang.String player)
        piecePlay is used to place the piece in the specific spot the user wants, it first uses the method checkForSpace, so the piecePlay dosen't work if the board it full, and after that the method looks a the specified column looking for an empty space starting from the bottom of the board
        Parameters:
        column - is used to specify the column the player wants to put their piece in
        player - refers to the X or O string variable which denoted which player is currently selected
        Returns:
        true if board is full or method finds spot to place piece and false if nothing is found, but due to if statements in the UI the false can never be hit, and it just the so the program compiles

      • winCheck

        public boolean winCheck()
        winCheck is a method which checks to see a player has connected 4, accounting for both diagonals, vertical, and horizontal victories.
        Returns:
        returns true if winCheck finds any 4 pieces in a row and false if it finds no consecutive 4 pieces in a row

      • checkInt

        public int checkInt()
        checkInt makes sure the user input is an int and does not break the program
        Returns:
        CheckInt returns a int to be processed or calls itself if they input something other than an int and uses recursion until the user supplies an int
        Throws:
        Looks - for and handles InputMismatchError, uses recursion in order to have the user supply the correct type of input

      • getCoordinates

        public int getCoordinates​(int column)
        getCoordinates return the exact position of the last piece played and is a helper method for Connect4Cleint
        Parameters:
        column - refers to the exact column in which the last piece was played
        Returns:
        returns the exact the position of the last piece played and a -1 as a base case that will never be touched
